director.name: 道格拉斯·肯尼 Douglas Kenney

introduction: As pilots fly, they're thrown every curve known to man and the laws of physics - and yet, little was truly about adapting the human body to these extremes. The answers only came from subjecting animals and humans to violent impacts, sudden decompressions, extremes of heat, cold and radiation - and more. Including many rare archival segments from official films, these are the results of far-ranging animal and human tests.
